moves.1. d4 e5 2. dxe5 Nc6 3. Nf3 Qe7 4. Bf4: In that case you could go with Qd5, I think is more active
moves.4... Qb4+ 5. Bd2 Qxb2 6. Nc3 Nb4 7. Nd4: I think a best move would be 9.Ndb5, trying 10.Nd5! and exploiting c7 and the black bad development
moves.10... Nxa2 11. Nd5 Qd8 12. c3 c4 13. Ra3: Off course this move did change the horizon, an accident. Better 13.Rb2
moves.18. Qxc4 d6 19. Qe4+ Kf7 20. Qc2 Nxc3 21: What a pressure over b4! This will give to the black the option to develop the board trough Ne7, Be6 and Rc8
Let me understand, why you take the queen when the final is almost lost? I think you have to get a chance with 28.Qg3
moves.28... dxc5 29. Nc2 a3 30. Bc3 Bf5 31. Ne: The black could continue with 48...Rg5, to give great freedom to this rook
moves.48. Kxb3 Rxg5 49. Kxc2 Rxf5 50. Bxa2 Rf2: With this move you are taking a previous draw, best of all would be 60.Bh7, trying Bg8 and I think there is more chances to win
